title: Construction of involution and inner product from a Hilbert lattice

blocks.name: clpoN
blocks.content: Extend class notation with all polarities of a left module or left vector space.
blocks.origin: const class clpoN { LPol }

blocks.name: diff.clpoN.s
diff.clpoN.c
diff.clpoN.w
df-lpolN
blocks.content: Define the set of all polarities of a left module or left vector space. A polarity is a kind of complementation operation on a subspace. The double polarity of a subspace is a closure operation. Based on Definition 3.2 of [Holland95] p. 214 for projective geometry polarities. For convenience, we open up the domain to include all vector subsets and not just subspaces, but any more restricted polarity can be converted to this one by taking the span of its argument. (Contributed by NM, 24-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-lpolN(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(clpoN, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, co(cfv(clss, cv(s0)), cmap, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)))), w3a(wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c0g, cv(s0)))), wal(s2, wal(s3, wi(w3a(wss(cv(s2), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wss(cv(s3), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wss(cv(s2), cv(s3))), wss(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))), wral(s2, cfv(clsa, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), cfv(clsh, cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cv(s2))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-lpolN(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ LPol =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà((LSubSp ` s0)[‚Ü¶]P((Base ` s0)))|((s1 `(Base ` s0))= {(0 ` s0)} ‚àß ‚àÄ(s2, ‚àÄ(s3,((s2 ‚äÜ(Base ` s0)‚àß s3 ‚äÜ(Base ` s0)‚àß s2 ‚äÜ s3)‚Üí(s1 ` s3)‚äÜ(s1 ` s2))))‚àß ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà(LSAtoms ` s0),((s1 ` s2)‚àà(LSHyp ` s0)‚àß(s1 `(s1 ` s2))= s2)))})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
}

thm lpolsetN(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí c2 = { s0 ‚àà(c3[‚Ü¶]P(c4))|((s0 ` c4)= { c5 } ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,((s1 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s2 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s1 ‚äÜ s2)‚Üí(s0 ` s2)‚äÜ(s0 ` s1))))‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c6,((s0 ` s1)‚àà c7 ‚àß(s0 `(s0 ` s1))= s1)))})
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(LSubSp ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(0 ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(LSAtoms ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(LSHyp ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(LPol ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c0)
} = {
  a1ii((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí c2 = { s0 ‚àà(c3[‚Ü¶]P(c4))|((s0 ` c4)= { c5 } ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,((s1 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s2 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s1 ‚äÜ s2)‚Üí(s0 ` s2)‚äÜ(s0 ` s1))))‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c6,((s0 ` s1)‚àà c7 ‚àß(s0 `(s0 ` s1))= s1)))}), d(s1, c6))

  elex(c0, c1)
  syl5eq(c2, { s0 ‚àà(c3[‚Ü¶]P(c4))|((s0 ` c4)= { c5 } ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,((s1 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s2 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s1 ‚äÜ s2)‚Üí(s0 ` s2)‚äÜ(s0 ` s1))))‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c6,((s0 ` s1)‚àà c7 ‚àß(s0 `(s0 ` s1))= s1)))}, (LPol ` c0), c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, universe, clpoN, { s0 ‚àà(c3[‚Ü¶]P(c4))|((s0 ` c4)= { c5 } ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,((s1 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s2 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s1 ‚äÜ s2)‚Üí(s0 ` s2)‚äÜ(s0 ` s1))))‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c6,((s0 ` s1)‚àà c7 ‚àß(s0 `(s0 ` s1))= s1)))}, { s0 ‚àà((LSubSp ` hs0)[‚Ü¶]P((Base ` hs0)))|((s0 `(Base ` hs0))= {(0 ` hs0)} ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,((s1 ‚äÜ(Base ` hs0)‚àß s2 ‚äÜ(Base ` hs0)‚àß s1 ‚äÜ s2)‚Üí(s0 ` s2)‚äÜ(s0 ` s1))))‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(LSAtoms ` hs0),((s0 ` s1)‚àà(LSHyp ` hs0)‚àß(s0 `(s0 ` s1))= s1)))})
  rabeqbidv(s0, ((LSubSp ` hs0)[‚Ü¶]P((Base ` hs0))), (c3[‚Ü¶]P(c4)), hs0 = c0, ((s0 `(Base ` hs0))= {(0 ` hs0)} ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,((s1 ‚äÜ(Base ` hs0)‚àß s2 ‚äÜ(Base ` hs0)‚àß s1 ‚äÜ s2)‚Üí(s0 ` s2)‚äÜ(s0 ` s1))))‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(LSAtoms ` hs0),((s0 ` s1)‚àà(LSHyp ` hs0)‚àß(s0 `(s0 ` s1))= s1))), ((s0 ` c4)= { c5 } ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,((s1 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s2 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s1 ‚äÜ s2)‚Üí(s0 ` s2)‚äÜ(s0 ` s1))))‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c6,((s0 ` s1)‚àà c7 ‚àß(s0 `(s0 ` s1))= s1))))

  3anbi123d(hs0 = c0, (s0 `(Base ` hs0))= {(0 ` hs0)}, ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,((s1 ‚äÜ(Base ` hs0)‚àß s2 ‚äÜ(Base ` hs0)‚àß s1 ‚äÜ s2)‚Üí(s0 ` s2)‚äÜ(s0 ` s1)))), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(LSAtoms ` hs0),((s0 ` s1)‚àà(LSHyp ` hs0)‚àß(s0 `(s0 ` s1))= s1)), (s0 ` c4)= { c5 }, ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,((s1 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s2 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß s1 ‚äÜ s2)‚Üí(s0 ` s2)‚äÜ(s0 ` s1)))), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c6,((s0 ` s1)‚àà c7 ‚àß(s0 `(s0 ` s1))= s1)))
  eqeq12d((s0 `(Base ` hs0)), {(0 ` hs0)}, (s0 ` c4), { c5 }, hs0 = c0)
  fveq2d(s0, (Base ` hs0), c4, hs0 = c0)
  sneqd((0 ` hs0), c5, hs0 = c0)

blocks.name: lcfl6lem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ lcfl6 . A functional ` G ` (whose kernel is closed by ~ dochsnkr ) is comletely determined by a vector ` X ` in the orthocomplement in its kernel at which the functional value is 1. Note that the ` \ { .0. } ` in the ` X ` hypothesis is redundant by the last hypothesis but allows easier use of other theorems. (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lcfl7N
blocks.content: Property of a functional with a closed kernel. Every nonzero functional is determined by a unique nonzero vector. Note that ` ( L `` G ) = V ` means the functional is zero by ~ lkr0f . (Contributed by NM, 4-Jan-2015.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: lclkrlem2r

blocks.name: lclkrlem2y
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ lclkr . Restate the hypotheses for ` E ` and ` G ` to say their kernels are closed, in order to eliminate the generating vectors ` X ` and ` Y ` . (Contributed by NM, 18-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lclkrlem2
blocks.content: The set of functionals having closed kernels is closed under vector (functional) addition. Lemmas ~ lclkrlem2a through ~ lclkrlem2y are used for the proof. Here we express ~ lclkrlem2y in terms of membership in the set ` C ` of functionals with closed kernels. (Contributed by NM, 18-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lclkr

blocks.name: lclkrslem2
blocks.content: The set of functionals having closed kernels and majorizing the orthocomplement of a given subspace ` Q ` is closed under scalar product. (Contributed by NM, 28-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lclkrs
blocks.content: The set of functionals having closed kernels and majorizing the orthocomplement of a given subspace ` R ` is a subspace of the dual space. TODO: This proof repeats large parts of the ~ lclkr proof. Do we achieve overall shortening by breaking them out as subtheorems? Or make ~ lclkr a special case of this? (Contributed by NM, 29-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lcfrlem5

blocks.name: lcfrlem9
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ lcf1o . (This part has undesirable $d's on ` J ` and ` ph ` that we remove in ~ lcf1o .) TODO: ugly proof; maybe have better subtheorems or abbreviate some ` iota_ k ` expansions with ` J `` z ` ? TODO: Some redundant $d's? (Contributed by NM, 22-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: lcf1o
blocks.content: Define a function ` J ` that provides a bijection from nonzero vectors ` V ` to nonzero functionals with closed kernels ` C ` . (Contributed by NM, 22-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: lcfr
blocks.content: Reconstruction of a subspace from a dual subspace of functionals with closed kernels. Our proof was suggested by Mario Carneiro, 20-Feb-2015. (Contributed by NM, 5-Mar-2015.)

df-mapd
blocks.content: Extend class notation with a one-to-one onto ( ~ mapd1o ), order-preserving ( ~ mapdord ) map, called a projectivity (definition of projectivity in [Baer] p. 40), from subspaces of vector space H to those subspaces of the dual space having functionals with closed kernels. (Contributed by NM, 25-Jan-2015.)

  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: mapdrval
blocks.content: Given a dual subspace ` R ` (of functionals with closed kernels), reconstruct the subspace ` Q ` that maps to it. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: mapd1o
blocks.content: The map defined by ~ df-mapd is one-to-one and onto the set of dual subspaces of functionals with closed kernels. This shows ` M ` satisfies part of the definition of projectivity of [Baer] p. 40. TODO: change theorems leading to this ( ~ lcfr , ~ mapdrval , ~ lclkrs , ~ lclkr ,...) to use ` T i^i ~P C ` ? TODO: maybe get rid of $d's for ` g ` versus ` K U W ` ; propagate to ~ mapdrn and any others. (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: mapd0

thm mapdat(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clsa, c8))
  -| wi(w0, wa(wcel(c4, chlt), wcel(c5, c3)))

} = {

  mapd0(c0, cfv(c0g, c6), cfv(c0g, c8), c3, c4, c5, c6, c8, w0)
  mpbid(w0, wbr(cfv(c0, csn(cfv(c0g, c6))), cfv(clcv, c8), cfv(c0, c1)), wbr(csn(cfv(c0g, c6)), cfv(clcv, c6), c1))
  lsatcv0(cfv(c0g, c6), cfv(clcv, c6), c1, c6, c7, w0)
  dvhlvec(c6, c3, c4, c5, w0)
  mapdcv(csn(cfv(c0g, c6)), cfv(clcv, c6), c1, c0, cfv(clcv, c8), c3, c4, c5, c6, cfv(clss, c6), c8, w0)
  eqid(cfv(clcv, c6))
  syl(w0, wcel(csn(cfv(c0g, c6)), cfv(clss, c6)), wcel(c6, clmod))

  mapdcl2(c0, c1, cfv(clss, c8), c3, c4, c5, c6, cfv(clss, c6), c8, w0)

thm mapdspex(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3))), cfv(c4, csn(cv(s0))))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(clh, c6))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cfv(cmpd, c6), c7))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c6), c7))
  -| wceq(c9, cfv(cbs, c8))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clspn, c8))
  -| wceq(c10, cfv(cfv(clcd, c6), c7))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c10))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(clspn, c10))
  -| wi(w0, wa(wcel(c6, chlt), wcel(c7, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c9))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c10)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  mpjaodan(w0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3))), cfv(c4, csn(cv(s0))))), wcel(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), cfv(clsa, c8)), wceq(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), csn(cfv(c0g, c8))))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), cfv(clsa, c8))), wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3))), cfv(c4, csn(cv(s0))))), wcel(c10, clmod), wcel(cfv(c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3))), cfv(clsa, c10)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), cfv(clsa, c8)), wcel(c10, clmod))
  mapdat(c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3)), cfv(clsa, c10), c5, c6, c7, c8, cfv(clsa, c8), c10, wa(w0, wcel(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), cfv(clsa, c8))))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), cfv(clsa, c8)), wa(wcel(c6, chlt), wcel(c7, c5)))
  simpr(w0, wcel(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), cfv(clsa, c8)))
  islsati(s0, c10, clmod, cfv(c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3))), cfv(clsa, c10), c0, c4)
  eqid(cfv(clsa, c10))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wceq(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), csn(cfv(c0g, c8)))), wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3))), cfv(c4, csn(cv(s0))))), wcel(cfv(c0g, c10), c0), wceq(cfv(c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3))), cfv(c4, csn(cfv(c0g, c10)))))
  adantr(w0, wceq(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), csn(cfv(c0g, c8))), wcel(cfv(c0g, c10), c0))
  lcd0vcl(cfv(c0g, c10), c0, c5, c6, c10, c7, w0)
  sylan9eqr(cfv(c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3))), cfv(c4, csn(cfv(c0g, c10))), cfv(c1, csn(cfv(c0g, c8))), w0, wceq(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), csn(cfv(c0g, c8))))
  fveq2(cfv(c2, csn(c3)), csn(cfv(c0g, c8)), c1)
  eqtr4d(cfv(c1, csn(cfv(c0g, c8))), cfv(c4, csn(cfv(c0g, c10))), csn(cfv(c0g, c10)), w0)
  mapd0(c1, cfv(c0g, c8), cfv(c0g, c10), c5, c6, c7, c8, c10, w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(cfv(c4, csn(cfv(c0g, c10))), csn(cfv(c0g, c10))), wcel(c10, clmod))
  lcdlmod(c10, c5, c6, c7, w0)
  lspsn0(c10, c4, cfv(c0g, c10))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c10))
  rspceeqv(s0, cfv(c0g, c10), c0, cfv(c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3))), cfv(c4, csn(cfv(c0g, c10))), cfv(c4, csn(cv(s0))))
  fveq2d(c4, csn(cv(s0)), csn(cfv(c0g, c10)), wceq(cv(s0), cfv(c0g, c10)))
  sneq(cv(s0), cfv(c0g, c10))
  lsator0sp(c2, c3, cfv(clsa, c8), cfv(c0g, c8), c9, c8, w0)
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c8))
  eqid(cfv(clsa, c8))
  dvhlmod(c8, c5, c6, c7, w0)
  diff.clmod.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1, cfv(c2, csn(c3)))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c2, csn(c3))
  diff.csn.s(s0, c3)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c4, csn(cfv(c0g, c10)))
  diff.csn.s(s0, cfv(c0g, c10))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0g, c10)
  diff.c0g.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: mapdpg
blocks.content: Part 1 of proof of the first fundamental theorem of projective geometry. Part (1) in [Baer] p. 44. Our notation corresponds to Baer's as follows: ` M ` for *, ` N `` { } ` for F(), ` J `` { } ` for G(), ` X ` for x, ` G ` for x', ` Y ` for y, ` h ` for y'. TODO: Rename variables per ~ mapdhval . (Contributed by NM, 22-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: baerlem3
blocks.content: An equality that holds when ` X ` , ` Y ` , ` Z ` are independent (non-colinear) vectors. Part (3) in [Baer] p. 45. TODO fix ref. (Contributed by NM, 9-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: baerlem5bmN
blocks.content: An equality that holds when ` X ` , ` Y ` , ` Z ` are independent (non-colinear) vectors. Subtraction version of second equation of part (5) in [Baer] p. 46. TODO: This is the subtraction version, may not be needed. TODO: delete if ~ baerlem5abmN is used. (Contributed by NM, 24-May-2015.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: baerlem5abmN
blocks.content: An equality that holds when ` X ` , ` Y ` , ` Z ` are independent (non-colinear) vectors. Subtraction versions of first and second equations of part (5) in [Baer] p. 46, conjoined to share commonality in their proofs. TODO: Delete if not needed. (Contributed by NM, 24-May-2015.) (New usage is discouraged.)

} = {

thm mapdindp0(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` {(c1[c2]c3)})=(c0 ` { c1 }))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c5)

  ‚ä£ c6 =(0 ` c5)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(LSpan ` c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c5 ‚àà LVec)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c7 ‚àà(c4 \ { c6 }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà(c4 \ { c6 }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 ‚àà(c4 \ { c6 }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí s0 ‚àà(c4 \ { c6 }))

  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` { c7 })‚â†(c0 ` { c1 }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí ¬¨ s0 ‚àà(c0 ` { c7, c1 }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c1[c2]c3)‚â† c6)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` {(c1[c2]c3)})=(c0 ` { c1 })), (w0 ‚Üí c7 ‚àà(c4 \ { c6 })))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` {(c1[c2]c3)})=(c0 ` { c1 })), (w0 ‚Üí s0 ‚àà(c4 \ { c6 })))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` {(c1[c2]c3)})=(c0 ` { c1 })), (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` { c7 })‚â†(c0 ` { c1 })))

thm mapdindp1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {

  lspsneq0(c6, c1, c5, c0, c7)
  adantl(w0, wceq(co(c2, c3, c4), c7), wceq(cfv(c0, csn(co(c2, c3, c4))), cfv(c0, csn(c7))))
  fveq2d(c0, csn(co(c2, c3, c4)), csn(c7), wceq(co(c2, c3, c4), c7))
  sneq(co(c2, c3, c4), c7)
  neeqtrrd(cfv(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(c0, csn(co(c2, c3, c4))), cfv(c0, csn(c2)), wa(w0, wne(co(c2, c3, c4), c7)))

  lspss(c6, { c1, c2 }, c5, { c1 }, c0)
  adantr(w0, (c2[c3]c4)= c7, ¬¨ s0 ‚àà(c0 ` { c1, c2 }))
  neleqtrrd(s0, (c0 ` { c1,(c2[c3]c4)}), (c0 ` { c1, c2 }), (w0 ‚àß(c2[c3]c4)‚â† c7))
  3eqtr4d((c0 ` { c1,(c2[c3]c4)}), (c0 ` { c1, c2 }), ((c0 ` { c1 })[(LSSum ` c6)](c0 ` {(c2[c3]c4)})), ((c0 ` { c1 })[(LSSum ` c6)](c0 ` { c2 })), (w0 ‚àß(c2[c3]c4)‚â† c7))
  oveq2d((c0 ` { c1 }), (LSSum ` c6), (c0 ` {(c2[c3]c4)}), (c0 ` { c2 }), (w0 ‚àß(c2[c3]c4)‚â† c7))
  mapdindp0(s0, c0, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, c1, (w0 ‚àß(c2[c3]c4)‚â† c7))

  lsmpr(c0, c1, (c2[c3]c4), (LSSum ` c6), c5, c6, w0)
  syl3anc(w0, (c2[c3]c4)‚àà c5, c6 ‚àà LMod, c2 ‚àà c5, c4 ‚àà c5)
  eldifad(c4, c5, { c7 }, w0)
  lmodvacl(c6, c2, c5, c4, c3)

thm mapdindp3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wne(cfv(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3)))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c5))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cplusg, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(c0g, c5))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(clspn, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, clvec))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cdif(c4, csn(c6))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cdif(c4, csn(c6))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, cdif(c4, csn(c6))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cdif(c4, csn(c6))))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, csn(c3)), cfv(c0, csn(c7))))
  -| wi(w0, wne(cfv(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(c0, csn(c3))))
  -| wi(w0, wn(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(c0, cpr(c1, c3)))))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wne(cfv(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3))))), wi(w0, wcel(c7, cdif(c4, csn(c6)))))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wne(cfv(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3))))), wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, csn(c3)), cfv(c0, csn(c7)))))
  mpd(w0, wne(cfv(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3)))), wn(wcel(c1, cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3))))))
  ssneldd(c1, cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3))), cfv(c0, cpr(cv(s0), c3)), w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wss(cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3))), cfv(c0, cpr(cv(s0), c3))), wcel(c5, clmod), wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(c3, c4))
  lspvadd(c5, cv(s0), c4, c3, c0, c2)
  simprd(w0, wn(wcel(c1, cfv(c0, cpr(cv(s0), c3)))), wne(cfv(c0, csn(cv(s0))), cfv(c0, csn(c3))))
  lspindp1(c0, cv(s0), c3, c1, c4, c5, c6, w0)
  eldifad(c3, c4, csn(c6), w0)
  eldifad(cv(s0), c4, csn(c6), w0)
  necon3bd(cfv(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3))), w0, wcel(c1, cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3)))))
  syl5ibcom(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3)))), wcel(c1, cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3)))), wcel(c1, cfv(c0, csn(c1))))
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(c1, cfv(c0, csn(c1))), wcel(c5, clmod), wcel(c1, c4))
  syl(w0, wcel(c5, clmod), wcel(c5, clvec))
  lveclmod(c5)
  eldifad(c1, c4, csn(c6), w0)
  lspsnid(c5, c1, c4, c0)
  eleq2(cfv(c0, csn(c1)), cfv(c0, csn(co(cv(s0), c2, c3))), c1)
}

thm mapdindp3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` { c1 })‚â†(c0 ` {(s0[c2]c3)}))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c5)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(+ ` c5)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(0 ` c5)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(LSpan ` c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c5 ‚àà LVec)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà(c4 \ { c6 }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 ‚àà(c4 \ { c6 }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c7 ‚àà(c4 \ { c6 }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí s0 ‚àà(c4 \ { c6 }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` { c3 })=(c0 ` { c7 }))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` { c1 })‚â†(c0 ` { c3 }))

} = {

  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` { c1 })‚â†(c0 ` {(s0[c2]c3)})), (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` { c3 })=(c0 ` { c7 })))
  mpd(w0, (c0 ` { c1 })‚â†(c0 ` {(s0[c2]c3)}), ¬¨ c1 ‚àà(c0 ` {(s0[c2]c3)}))

  lspvadd(c5, s0, c4, c3, c0, c2)
  simprd(w0, ¬¨ c1 ‚àà(c0 ` { s0, c3 }), (c0 ` { s0 })‚â†(c0 ` { c3 }))
  lspindp1(c0, s0, c3, c1, c4, c5, c6, w0)
  eldifad(c3, c4, { c6 }, w0)
  eldifad(s0, c4, { c6 }, w0)
  necon3bd((c0 ` { c1 }), (c0 ` {(s0[c2]c3)}), w0, c1 ‚àà(c0 ` {(s0[c2]c3)}))
  syl5ibcom(w0, (c0 ` { c1 })=(c0 ` {(s0[c2]c3)}), c1 ‚àà(c0 ` {(s0[c2]c3)}), c1 ‚àà(c0 ` { c1 }))
  syl2anc(w0, c1 ‚àà(c0 ` { c1 }), c5 ‚àà LMod, c1 ‚àà c4)

blocks.content: Extend class notation with a map from each nonzero vector ` x ` to a unique nonzero functional in the closed kernel dual space. (We could extend it to include the zero vector, but that is unnecessary for our purposes.) blocks.name: lspindp5
blocks.content: Obtain an independent vector set ` U , X , Y ` from a vector ` U ` dependent on ` X ` and ` Z ` and another independent set ` Z , X , Y ` . (Here we don't show the ` ( N `` { X } ) =/= ( N `` { Y } ) ` part of the independence, which passes straight through. We also don't show nonzero vector requirements that are redundant for this theorem. Different orderings can be obtained using ~ lspexch and ~ prcom .) (Contributed by NM, 4-May-2015.)

blocks.name: mapdh8
blocks.content: Part (8) in [Baer] p. 48. Given a reference vector ` X ` , the value of function ` I ` at a vector ` T ` is independent of the choice of auxiliary vectors ` Y ` and ` Z ` . Unlike Baer's, our version does not require ` X ` , ` Y ` , and ` Z ` to be independent, and also is defined for all ` Y ` and ` Z ` that are not colinear with ` X ` or ` T ` . We do this to make the definition of Baer's sigma function more straightforward. (This part eliminates ` T =/= .0. ` .) (Contributed by NM, 13-May-2015.)

blocks.name: hdmap1valc
blocks.content: Connect the value of the preliminary map from vectors to functionals ` I ` to the hypothesis ` L ` used by earlier theorems. Note: the ` X e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ` hypothesis could be the more general ` X e. V ` but the former will be easier to use. TODO: use the ` I ` function directly in those theorems, so this theorem becomes unnecessary? TODO: The ~ hdmap1cbv is probably unnecessary, but it would mean different $d's later on. (Contributed by NM, 15-May-2015.)

blocks.name: hdmapval
blocks.content: Value of map from vectors to functionals in the closed kernel dual space. This is the function sigma on line 27 above part 9 in [Baer] p. 48. We select a convenient fixed reference vector ` E ` to be ` <. 0 , 1 >. ` (corresponding to vector u on p. 48 line 7) whose span is the lattice isomorphism map of the fiducial atom ` P = ( ( oc `` K ) `` W ) ` (see ~ dvheveccl ). ` ( J `` E ) ` is a fixed reference functional determined by this vector (corresponding to u' on line 8; ~ mapdhvmap shows in Baer's notation (Fu)* = Gu'). Baer's independent vectors v and w on line 7 correspond to our ` z ` that the ` A. z e. V ` ranges over. The middle term ` ( I `` <. E , ( J `` E ) , z >. ) ` provides isolation to allow ` E ` and ` T ` to assume the same value without conflict. Closure is shown by ~ hdmapcl . If a separate auxiliary vector is known, ~ hdmapval2 provides a version without quantification. (Contributed by NM, 15-May-2015.)

This shows the inner product condition in the proof of Theorem 3.6 of [Holland95] p. 14 line 32, ` [ ` e , e ` ] =/= 0 ` is satisfied. TODO: remove redundant hypothesis hdmapevec.j. (Contributed by NM, 1-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: hdmapf1oN
blocks.content: Part 12 in [Baer] p. 49. The map from vectors to functionals with closed kernels maps one-to-one onto. Combined with ~ hdmapadd , this shows the map is an automorphism from the additive group of vectors to the additive group of functionals with closed kernels. (Contributed by NM, 30-May-2015.) (New usage is discouraged.)

  hdmap11(c0, cv(hs0), cv(hs1), c3, c4, c5, c6, c1, wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wa(wcel(c4, chlt), wcel(c6, c3)))

blocks.name: hgmapval
blocks.content: Value of map from the scalar division ring of the vector space to the scalar division ring of its closed kernel dual. Function sigma of scalar f in part 14 of [Baer] p. 50 line 4. TODO: variable names are inherited from older version. Maybe make more consistent with ~ hdmap14lem15 . (Contributed by NM, 25-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: hdmapinvlem4
blocks.content: Part 1.1 of Proposition 1 of [Baer] p. 110. We use ` C ` , ` D ` , ` I ` , and ` J ` for Baer's u, v, s, and t. Our unit vector ` E ` has the required properties for his w by ~ hdmapevec2 . Our ` ( ( S `` D ) `` C ) ` means his f(u,v) (note argument reversal). (Contributed by NM, 12-Jun-2015.)

In the proof, our ` E ` , ` ( O `` { E } ) ` ` X ` , ` Y ` , ` k ` , ` u ` , ` l ` , ` v ` correspond to Baer's w, H, x, y, x', x'', y' , y'', and our ` ( ( S `` Y ) `` X ) ` corresponds to Baer's f(x,y). (Contributed by NM, 14-Jun-2015.)

blocks.content: Define our final Hilbert space constructed from a Hilbert lattice. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-hlhil(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  |- wceq(chlh, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpt(s1, cfv(clh, cv(s0)), csb(s2, cfv(cfv(cdvh, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), csb(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s2)), cun(ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cv(s3)), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), cfv(cplusg, cv(s2))), cop(cfv(csca, cnx), co(cfv(cfv(cedring, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), csts, cop(cfv(cstv, cnx), cfv(cfv(chg, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))))), cpr(cop(cfv(cvsca, cnx), cfv(cvsca, cv(s2))), cop(cfv(cip, cnx), cmpo(s4, s5, cv(s3), cv(s3), cfv(cfv(cfv(cfv(chdma, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cv(s5)), cv(s4)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)

  -| diffss(s4, s5)
}

axiom df-hlhil(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  ‚ä¢ HLHil =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(LHyp ` s0)‚Ü¶[((DVecH ` s0)` s1)/ s2][(Base ` s2)/ s3]({ <(Base ` ndx), s3 >, <(+ ` ndx),(+ ` s2)>, <(Scalar ` ndx),(((EDRing ` s0)` s1)[sSet]<(*r ` ndx),((HGMap ` s0)` s1)>)> } ‚ãÉ { <(√ó ` ndx),(√ó ` s2)>, <(¬∑ ` ndx),(s4 ‚àà s3, s5 ‚àà s3 ‚Ü¶((((HDMap ` s0)` s1)` s5)` s4))> })))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s5)
}

  hgmapadd(c10, cv(hs0), c8, cv(hs1), c1, c2, c5, c4, c6, c7, w3a(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c7)))

  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wa(wcel(c2, chlt), wcel(c4, c1)))

  diff.hs0.c(c7)

thm hlhilocv(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c2, c1)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(clh, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c4), c6))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cfv(chlh, c4), c6))
  -| wi(w0, wa(wcel(c4, chlt), wcel(c6, c3)))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(cbs, c5))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cfv(coch, c4), c6))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cocv, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, c8))
} = {
  3eqtr4d(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c2, c1), crab(hs0, cfv(cbs, c7), wral(hs1, c1, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7))))), crab(hs0, c8, wral(hs1, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cfv(cfv(chdma, c4), c6), cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c5))))), w0)
  eqtr3d(crab(hs0, cfv(cbs, c7), wral(hs1, c1, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7))))), crab(hs0, c8, wral(hs1, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cfv(cfv(chdma, c4), c6), cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c5))))), crab(hs0, c8, wral(hs1, c1, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7))))), w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(crab(hs0, c8, wral(hs1, c1, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7))))), crab(hs0, cfv(cbs, c7), wral(hs1, c1, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)))))), wceq(c8, cfv(cbs, c7)))
  rabeq(hs0, c8, cfv(cbs, c7), wral(hs1, c1, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)))))
  rabbidva(hs0, c8, w0, wral(hs1, c1, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)))), wral(hs1, c1, wceq(cfv(cfv(cfv(cfv(chdma, c4), c6), cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c5)))))
  ralbidva(hs1, c1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c8)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7))), wceq(cfv(cfv(cfv(cfv(chdma, c4), c6), cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c5))))
  eqeq12d(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)), cfv(cfv(cfv(cfv(chdma, c4), c6), cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c5)), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c8)), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)))
  hlhilipval(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1), cfv(cfv(chdma, c4), c6), c3, c4, c5, c6, c8, c7, wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c8)), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c8), wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wa(wcel(c4, chlt), wcel(c6, c3)))
  simplr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c8), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))
  sselda(cv(hs1), c1, c8, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c8)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c8), wss(c1, c8))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c8), wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wceq(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c5))))
  eqcomd(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c5)), w0)
  hlhils0(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c5)), cfv(csca, c7), c3, c4, c5, c6, cfv(csca, c5), c7, w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), crab(hs0, cfv(cbs, c7), wral(hs1, c1, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cip, c7), cv(hs1)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)))))), wss(c1, cfv(cbs, c7)))
  sseqtrd(c1, cfv(cbs, c7), c8, w0)
  hlhilbase(c8, c7, c3, c4, c6, c5, w0)
  ocvval(hs0, hs1, c1, cfv(cbs, c7), c0, cfv(cip, c7), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)), c7, cfv(csca, c7))

  eqid(cfv(cip, c7))
  eqid(cfv(csca, c7))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)))
  hdmapoc(hs0, hs1, c2, c1, c8, cfv(cfv(chdma, c4), c6), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c5)), c3, c4, c5, c6, cfv(csca, c5), w0)
  eqid(cfv(csca, c5))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c5)))
  eqid(cfv(cfv(chdma, c4), c6))
  diff.hs0.c(c8)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, c7))
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs1.w(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c8)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cip, c7))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)))
  diff.hs0.c(c7)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(cbs, c7))
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(cip, c7))
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, c7)))
  diff.hs1.c(c7)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c8)
  diff.hs1.w(w0)

thm hlhilocv(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)=(c2 ` c1))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(LHyp ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c5 =((DVecH ` c4)` c6)
  ‚ä£ c7 =((HLHil ` c4)` c6)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c4 ‚àà HL ‚àß c6 ‚àà c3))
  ‚ä£ c8 =(Base ` c5)
  ‚ä£ c2 =((ocH ` c4)` c6)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(ocv ` c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚äÜ c8)
} = {
  3eqtr4d((c0 ` c1), (c2 ` c1), { hs0 ‚àà(Base ` c7)| ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,(hs0[(¬∑ ` c7)]hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c7)))}, { hs0 ‚àà c8 | ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,((((HDMap ` c4)` c6)` hs1)` hs0)=(0 `(Scalar ` c5)))}, w0)
  eqtr3d({ hs0 ‚àà(Base ` c7)| ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,(hs0[(¬∑ ` c7)]hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c7)))}, { hs0 ‚àà c8 | ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,((((HDMap ` c4)` c6)` hs1)` hs0)=(0 `(Scalar ` c5)))}, { hs0 ‚àà c8 | ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,(hs0[(¬∑ ` c7)]hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c7)))}, w0)
  syl(w0, { hs0 ‚àà c8 | ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,(hs0[(¬∑ ` c7)]hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c7)))} = { hs0 ‚àà(Base ` c7)| ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,(hs0[(¬∑ ` c7)]hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c7)))}, c8 =(Base ` c7))
  rabeq(hs0, c8, (Base ` c7), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,(hs0[(¬∑ ` c7)]hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c7))))
  rabbidva(hs0, c8, w0, ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,(hs0[(¬∑ ` c7)]hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c7))), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,((((HDMap ` c4)` c6)` hs1)` hs0)=(0 `(Scalar ` c5))))
  ralbidva(hs1, c1, (w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c8), (hs0[(¬∑ ` c7)]hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c7)), ((((HDMap ` c4)` c6)` hs1)` hs0)=(0 `(Scalar ` c5)))
  eqeq12d((hs0[(¬∑ ` c7)]hs1), (0 `(Scalar ` c7)), ((((HDMap ` c4)` c6)` hs1)` hs0), (0 `(Scalar ` c5)), ((w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c8)‚àß hs1 ‚àà c1))
  hlhilipval(hs0, (¬∑ ` c7), hs1, ((HDMap ` c4)` c6), c3, c4, c5, c6, c8, c7, ((w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c8)‚àß hs1 ‚àà c1))
  ad2antrr(w0, hs0 ‚àà c8, hs1 ‚àà c1, (c4 ‚àà HL ‚àß c6 ‚àà c3))
  simplr(w0, hs0 ‚àà c8, hs1 ‚àà c1)
  sselda(hs1, c1, c8, (w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c8))
  adantr(w0, hs0 ‚àà c8, c1 ‚äÜ c8)
  ad2antrr(w0, hs0 ‚àà c8, hs1 ‚àà c1, (0 `(Scalar ` c7))=(0 `(Scalar ` c5)))
  eqcomd((0 `(Scalar ` c7)), (0 `(Scalar ` c5)), w0)
  hlhils0((0 `(Scalar ` c5)), (Scalar ` c7), c3, c4, c5, c6, (Scalar ` c5), c7, w0)
  syl(w0, (c0 ` c1)= { hs0 ‚àà(Base ` c7)| ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c1,(hs0[(¬∑ ` c7)]hs1)=(0 `(Scalar ` c7)))}, c1 ‚äÜ(Base ` c7))
  sseqtrd(c1, (Base ` c7), c8, w0)
  hlhilbase(c8, c7, c3, c4, c6, c5, w0)
  ocvval(hs0, hs1, c1, (Base ` c7), c0, (¬∑ ` c7), (0 `(Scalar ` c7)), c7, (Scalar ` c7))
  eqid((Base ` c7))
  eqid((¬∑ ` c7))
  eqid((Scalar ` c7))
  eqid((0 `(Scalar ` c7)))
  hdmapoc(hs0, hs1, c2, c1, c8, ((HDMap ` c4)` c6), (0 `(Scalar ` c5)), c3, c4, c5, c6, (Scalar ` c5), w0)
  eqid((Scalar ` c5))
  eqid((0 `(Scalar ` c5)))
  eqid(((HDMap ` c4)` c6))
  diff.hs0.c(c8)
  diff.hs0.c((Base ` c7))
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs1.w((w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c8))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c((¬∑ ` c7))
  diff.hs0.c((0 `(Scalar ` c7)))
  diff.hs0.c(c7)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c((Base ` c7))
  diff.hs1.c((¬∑ ` c7))
  diff.hs1.c((0 `(Scalar ` c7)))
  diff.hs1.c(c7)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c8)
  diff.hs1.w(w0)
}

thm hlhillcs(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

  eqrdv(hs0, c0, crn(c1), w0)
  impbida(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1)))
  mpbird(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0)))))
  biimpa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0)))))

  cssss(cv(hs0), c0, cfv(cbs, c5), c5)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c5))
  bitr4d(wa(w0, wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c5))), wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)))
  dochoccl(cv(hs0), c1, cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), c2, c3, c4, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4), cfv(cbs, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4)), wa(w0, wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c5))))
  syl5bb(wa(w0, wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c5))), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)))
  eqcom(cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0))))
  eqeq1d(cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), wa(w0, wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c5))))
  eqtrd(cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0))), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), wa(w0, wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c5))))
  fveq2d(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0)), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c5))))
  hlhilocv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), c2, c3, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4), c4, c5, cfv(cbs, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4)), wa(w0, wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c5))))
  hlhilocv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0)), cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), c2, c3, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4), c4, c5, cfv(cbs, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4)), wa(w0, wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c5))))

  sseq2d(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4)), cfv(cbs, c5), w0)
  hlhilbase(cfv(cbs, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4)), c5, c2, c3, c4, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4), w0)
  mpd(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1)))
  simpr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1)))
  3imtr4d(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0)))))
  ex(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))), wceq(cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0)))))
  eqcomd(cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0))), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))), wceq(cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0))))
  biimpar(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))), wceq(cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)))
  eqeq1d(cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))))
  eqtrd(cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0))), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))))
  fveq2d(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0)), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))))
  hlhilocv(cfv(cocv, c5), cv(hs0), cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), c2, c3, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4), c4, c5, cfv(cbs, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))))
  hlhilocv(cfv(cocv, c5), cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0)), cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), c2, c3, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4), c4, c5, cfv(cbs, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c1))), wss(cfv(cfv(cfv(coch, c3), c4), cv(hs0)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4))), wa(wcel(c3, chlt), wcel(c4, c2)), wss(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, cfv(cfv(cdvh, c3), c4))))

blocks.name: hlathil
blocks.content: Construction of a Hilbert space ( ~ df-hil ) ` U ` from a Hilbert lattice ( ~ df-hlat ) ` K ` , where ` W ` is a fixed but arbitrary hyperplane (co-atom) in ` K ` . The Hilbert space ` U ` is identical to the vector space ` ( ( DVecH `` K ) `` W ) ` (see ~ dvhlvec ) except that it is extended with involution and inner product components. The construction of these two components is provided by Theorem 3.6 in [Holland95] p. 13, whose proof we follow loosely. An example of involution is the complex conjugate when the division ring is the field of complex numbers. The nature of the division ring we constructed is indeterminate, however, until we specialize the initial Hilbert lattice with additional conditions found by Maria Solèr in 1995 and refined by René Mayet in 1998 that result in a division ring isomorphic to ` CC ` . See additional discussion at ~ http://us.metamath.org/qlegif/mmql.html#what . ` W ` corresponds to the w in the proof of Theorem 13.4 of [Crawley] p. 111. Such a ` W ` always exists since ` HL ` has lattice rank of at least 4 by ~ df-hil . It can be eliminated if we just want to show the existence of a Hilbert space, as is done in the literature. (Contributed by NM, 23-Jun-2015.)
